Dear Mr. Walker:
, This will acknowledge receipt of your
letter of March 25 about NAEB’s personnel place¬
ment plans. We have not yet heard from Mr. Griffiths
but are delighted that you will shortly be in posi¬
tion to undertake this work and, of course, we will
cooperate in every way with you.
For the past few months we have had a
person working full time on this assignment and
have developed a card file, questionnaire and
other devices which I think that for the time be¬
ing, and for our convenience here, we shall want
to continue, as we have certain needs thajt are per¬
haps somewhat distinct from yours.
So, I would suggest that some time after
May 1, or after you have had time to get your shop
set up and your procedures and scope all determined,
you plan to spend a few days with us here in Wash¬
ington to see how the operations can best be carried
forward.
Cordially,
i
Robert R. Mullen
Executive Director
